medium_description_en: Estimates whole body fat percentage among adults.
instructions_en: Use this tool to estimate body adiposity in adult patients ≥20 years.

seo.meta_description_en: The Relative Fat Mass (RFM) estimates whole body fat percentage among adults.
seo.keywords_en: Relative Fat Mass (RFM), rfm, fat mass, body fat, body mass, obesity, relative mass, fat, bmi, bsa, body mass index

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use Relative Fat Mass (RFM) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

next_steps.advice_en: Do you use Relative Fat Mass (RFM) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.formula_en:
RFM = 64 – (20 x (height/waist)) + (12 x sex*)

*sex = 0 for male, 1 for female
about.more_info_en: Obesity is defined as RFM ≥33.9% for women and ≥22.8% for men.

Validation.text: Guzmán-León AE, Velarde AG, Vidal-Salas M, Urquijo-Ruiz LG, Caraveo-Gutiérrez LA, Valencia ME. External validation of the relative fat mass (Rfm) index in adults from north-west Mexico using different reference methods. PLoS One. 2019;14(12):e0226767.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Woolcott OO, Bergman RN. Relative fat mass (Rfm) as a new estimator of whole-body fat percentage ─ A cross-sectional study in American adult individuals. Sci Rep. 2018;8(1):10980.

Other References.text: Corrêa CR, Formolo NPS, Dezanetti T, Speretta GFF, Nunes EA. Relative fat mass is a better tool to diagnose high adiposity when compared to body mass index in young male adults: A cross-section study. Clin Nutr ESPEN. 2021;41:225-233.
Woolcott OO, Bergman RN. Defining cutoffs to diagnose obesity using the relative fat mass (Rfm): Association with mortality in NHANES 1999-2014. Int J Obes (Lond). 2020;44(6):1301-1310.
Woolcott OO, Bergman RN. Relative Fat Mass as an estimator of whole-body fat percentage among children and adolescents: A cross-sectional study using NHANES. Sci Rep. 2019;9(1):15279.

creator_info.about_en: Orison O. Woolcott, MD, is a physiology and epidemiology researcher affiliated with the Ronin Institute in Montclair, NJ and the Institute for Globally Distributed Open Research and Education (IGDORE) in Sweden. He is also a senior editor of The Lancet Regional Health. Dr. Woolcott’s primary research is focused on obesity and diabetes.
